subject: Medicine
title: Clinical Trial Diversity
description: A quick win: understand Clinical Trial Diversity.

hook.text: Most clinical trials over-represent white men. Drugs tested on one group may not work the same in others.

buildup.text: Historically, women, minorities, and elderly patients were excluded from trials that shaped treatment standards.

discovery.text: Drug metabolism, dosing, and side effects can vary significantly by sex, age, and ethnicity.

twist.text: Ambien's dose for women was cut in half in 2013 after years of overdosingâ€”it metabolizes more slowly in women.

climax.text: Inclusive trials aren't just ethicalâ€”they produce safer, more effective medicine for everyone.

punchline.text: Medicine for everyone must be tested on everyone.

quiz.question: Why was Ambien's dose for women changed in 2013?
options: Women metabolize it more slowly, leading to years of overdosing
Men were found to need a higher dose for the same effect
The drug was reformulated with different ingredients
